Episodes

Season 1: A new episode launches every Thursday beginning January 13, 2022.

Click here to open player in a new window

Season 1: Release Dates (Spring 2022)

New episode released every Thursday, beginning January 13, 2022. Click on episode name for credits and supplementary materials (updated throughout the season).

• Episode 1.1 (January 13, 2022) - Scott Murphy, “Buxtehude Beats Bach? Qualifying a Canonic Claim”
• Episode 1.2 (January 20, 2022) - Joe Straus, “Musicking While Old: Old Age as Culture” (1/5)
• Episode 1.3 (January 27, 2022) - John Baxter, “The Teardrop Chord: Analyzing the Enigmatic Minor IV Chord in Pop and Film Music”
• Episode 1.4 (February 3, 2022) - Joe Straus, “Musicking While Old: Old Age + Opera” (2/5)
• Episode 1.5 (February 10, 2022) - Matt Ferrandino, “Sonic Identity, Imitation, and Critical Listening in Popular Music”
• Episode 1.6 (February 17, 2022) - Elizabeth Newton & Franklin Bruno, “The Inside of the Tune: Analyzing the Bridge in Pop”
• Episode 1.7 (February 24, 2022) - Chris Doll, “Is Key Real?”
• Episode 1.8 (March 3, 2022) - Joe Straus, “Musicking While Old: Old Composers” (3/5)
• Episode 1.9 (March 10, 2022) - Nate Mitchell, Sarah A. Gilbert, Timothy Byron, & Justice Srisuk, “Facilitating Musical Discussions on Reddit: An Interdisciplinary Conversation"
• Episode 1.10 (March 17, 2022) - Lucia Pasini, “Women composers in fin-de-siècle Paris: Augusta Holmès, Cécile Chaminade, and Jane Vieu”
• Episode 1.11 (March 24, 2022) - Tyler Howie & Matt Chiu, “Untangling and Complicating Generic Boundaries in Post(-Millenial) Punk”
• Episode 1.12 (March 31, 2022) - Nicholas Hunter, “Dialogic and Tropological Processes in Lili Boulanger’s Faust et Hélène”
• Episode 1.13 (April 7, 2022) - Joe Straus, “Musicking While Old: Old Performers” (4/5)
• Episode 1.14 (April 14, 2022) - Kim Soby with Elizabeth Austin, “Misogyny in 19th Century Lieder”
• Episode 1.15 (April 21, 2022) - Landon Morrison, “Making Orchestras Speak/Making Computers Listen”
• Episode 1.16 (April 28, 2022) - Jennifer Campbell, “Journeys Through Middleground: Holding Space Between Academic Analysis and YouTube Entertainment”
• Episode 1.17 (May 5, 2022) - Joe Straus, “Musicking While Old: Old Listeners” (5/5)
